content:
A vinyl enthusiast and a Pokémon card collector, eh? I'm happy to help you with storage and display solutions for both your passions!

**Record Storage Crate or Shelf:**
For storing and displaying 50-60 records, you have several options. Here are a few recommendations:

1. **Crate-style storage:**
	* **UO Rotating Record Crate**: A sturdy, compact crate that holds up to 60 records and has a rotating design for easy access. ($40-$50)
	* ** Crosley Record Crate**: A classic, wooden crate that stores up to 50 records and has a hinged lid. ($30-$40)
2. **Shelf-style storage:**
	* **IKEA Kallax Shelving Unit**: A versatile, affordable shelving unit that can be configured to hold 50-60 records. You can add more shelves as your collection grows. ($20-$30 per shelf)
	* **Audio-Technica AT-LP60BK Record Storage Shelf**: A specifically designed record shelf that holds up to 60 records and has a sleek, compact design. ($40-$50)
3. **Hybrid storage:**
	* **Pro-Ject Record Box S**: A wooden record storage box with a lift-top lid that holds up to 50 records and has a built-in shelf for displaying a few favorite records. ($50-$60)

When choosing a storage solution, consider the space you have available, your budget, and the style you prefer. Make sure the storage unit is sturdy and protects your records from damage.

**Pokémon Card Storage and Display:**
For your Pokémon card collection, you'll want to store and display them in a way that protects them from damage and showcases your favorite cards. Here are some recommendations:

1. **Binder and Pages:**
	* **Ultra Pro Pokémon Trading Card Binder**: A high-quality binder designed specifically for Pokémon cards, with pages that can hold up to 60 cards. ($10-$20)
	* **Pokémon Trading Card Album**: A binder with pre-printed pages featuring Pokémon artwork, perfect for showcasing your favorite cards. ($15-$30)
2. **Display Cases:**
	* **BCW Pokémon Trading Card Display Case**: A clear, protective display case that holds up to 12 cards and can be mounted on a wall or placed on a shelf. ($10-$20)
	* **Ultra Pro Pokémon Trading Card Display Frame**: A stylish, framed display case that holds up to 9 cards and can be hung on a wall. ($20-$30)

When storing and displaying your Pokémon cards, make sure to handle them carefully to prevent damage. You may also want to consider grading and slabbing your rare cards for added protection and authenticity.

I hope this helps you get started on organizing and showcasing your vinyl record and Pokémon card collections!
